chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (fewer than 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (fewer than 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A. Millard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (3 or More 1st Degree Acts), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(ag).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence is concurrent to Jackson County case being currently served. Defendant granted credit for 192 days served. Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Sentence is concurrent to Jackson County case being currently served.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent. 
Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request.

Defendant is to comply with sex offender assessment and follow through with recommendations.

Defendant is to comply with the Sex Offender Registry Program.

The defendant shall have no contact with HNS or her immediate family  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises or if it is within the scope of employment but is to remain alcohol free. .  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed. Defendant shall obtain all perscriptions from a single pharmacy.

Defendant shall not have any unsupervised contact with any person under age 18 without agent approval.
Court granted the State 60 days from sentencing to file a request for restitution and or request a restitution hearing.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Sentence is concurrent to Jackson County case being currently served.
